text: Will Keith "W.K." Kellogg (April 7, 1860 - October 6, 1951) was an American industrialist in food manufacturing, best known as the founder of the Kellogg Company. His brother was John Harvey Kellogg. Kellogg was born on April 7, 1860 in Battle Creek, Michigan.Kellogg, Will Keith — Overview, Personal life, Chronology: Will Keith Kellogg, Career details, Social and economic impact Online 1911 Encyclopædia Britannica He was married to Ella Osborn Davis from 1880 until her death in 1912. They had five children. Then he was married to Carrie Staines from 1918 until her death in 1948. Kellogg died on October 6, 1951 in Battle Creek, Michigan from heart failure, aged 91. ==References== ==Other websites== *Genealogy wiki * Category:1860 births Category:1951 deaths Category:People with foods named after them Category:Businesspeople from Michigan Category:American chief executives Category:People from Battle Creek, Michigan
title: Will Keith Kellogg
